-100,200,300,300,40,1;    300,300,300,300,110,0;    300,300,-100,400,40,-1;;;
-50,450,180,400,50,1;		180,400,80,-100,120,-1;;;
-50,180,180,260,120,1;     180,260,240,280,30,1;    240,280,300,260,30,1;     300,260,530,180,120,1;;;
50,-100,50,900,1000,0;;;
-50,200,250,250,25,1;     250,250,350,450,120,1;     350,450,530,500,25,1;;;
-50,200,0,250,20,1;     0,250,50,200,20,1;     50,200,100,250,20,1;     100,250,150,200,20,1;     150,200,200,250,20,1;     200,250,250,200,20,1;     250,200,300,250,20,1;     300,250,350,200,20,1;     350,200,400,250,20,1;     400,250,450,200,20,1;     450,200,500,250,20,1;     500,250,550,200,20,1;;;
300,-50,200,300,100,1;     200,300,100,380,30,1;     100,380,-50,450,30,1;;;
530,480,400,460,30,-1;     400,460,350,410,20,-1;     350,410,320,300,30,-1;     320,300,350,200,25,1;     350,200,530,-50,60,1;;;


//  <-- Trennzeichen für den Code

Weg der Gegner
x_start, y_start, x_end, y_end, Frames, ModelArt [-1 = left] [0 = normal] [1 = right]

Es wird immer der komplette Weg in ein Listenelement geladen und dann komplett abgefragt
